intro: Gompholobium huegelii var. leptophyllum, commonly known as the slender-leaved gompholobium, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and often nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows as a shrub with narrow, linear leaves and produces bright yellow or orange flowers. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought tolerance and efficient water use. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and ecological importance in supporting local fauna.
